pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:0.3.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing expulsion

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:0.4.eng: The fourth training rule on expulsion

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā vesāliyaṃ viharati mahāvane kūṭāgārasālāyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying in the hall with the peaked roof in the Great Wood near Vesālī,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā sandiṭṭhā sambhattā bhikkhū vaggumudāya nadiyā tīre vassaṃ upagacchiṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.2.eng: a number of monks who were friends had entered the rainy-season residence on the banks of the river Vaggumudā.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.3.pli: Tena kho pana samayena vajjī dubbhikkhā hoti dvīhitikā setaṭṭhikā salākāvuttā,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.3.eng: At that time Vajjī was short of food and afflicted with hunger, with crops affected by whiteheads and turned to straw.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.3.comm: “Whiteheads” renders setaṭṭ(h)ikā, literally, “white bones”. Sp 4.403: Setaṭṭhikā nāma rogajātīti eko pāṇako nāḷimajjhagataṁ kaṇḍaṁ vijjhati, yena viddhattā nikkhantampi sālisīsaṁ khīraṁ gahetuṁ na sakkoti, “The disease called setaṭṭhikā means: an insect penetrates the stem, goes to the middle of the stalk, from the penetration of which the rice grains are not able to get sap.” This seems to be a description of so-called “whiteheads”, pale panicles without rice grains, caused by stem borers.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.4.eng: It was not easy to get by on almsfood.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.5.pli: Atha kho tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ etadahosi—“etarahi kho vajjī dubbhikkhā dvīhitikā setaṭṭhikā salākāvuttā, na sukarā uñchena paggahena yāpetuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.5.eng: The monks considered the difficult circumstances, and they thought,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.6.pli: Kena nu kho mayaṃ upāyena samaggā sammodamānā avivadamānā phāsukaṃ vassaṃ vaseyyāma,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.6.eng: “How can we have a comfortable rains, live in peace and harmony,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.10.eng: and they’ll support us in return.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.11.pli: Evaṃ mayaṃ samaggā sammodamānā avivadamānā phāsukaṃ vassaṃ vasissāma,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.14.eng: “There’s no need to work for the householders.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.15.pli: Handa mayaṃ, āvuso, gihīnaṃ dūteyyaṃ harāma,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.15.eng: Let’s instead take messages for them,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.16.eng: and they’ll support us in return.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.17.pli: Evaṃ mayaṃ samaggā sammodamānā avivadamānā phāsukaṃ vassaṃ vasissāma,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.20.eng: “There’s no need to work or take messages for them.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.22.pli: Handa mayaṃ, āvuso, gihīnaṃ aññamaññassa uttarimanussadhammassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsissāma—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.22.eng: Let’s instead talk up one another’s superhuman qualities to the householders:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.31.eng: that monk has the three true insights,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.32.eng: and that the six direct knowledges.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.34.pli: Evaṃ mayaṃ samaggā sammodamānā avivadamānā phāsukaṃ vassaṃ vasissāma,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.34.eng: In this way we’ll have a comfortable rains, live together in peace and harmony,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.36.pli: “Esoyeva kho, āvuso, seyyo yo amhākaṃ gihīnaṃ aññamaññassa uttarimanussadhammassa vaṇṇo bhāsito”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.36.eng: This is the way to go.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.37.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū gihīnaṃ aññamaññassa uttarimanussadhammassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsiṃsu—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.37.eng: Then those monks did just that.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.41.pli: “lābhā vata no, suladdhaṃ vata no, yesaṃ no evarūpā bhikkhū vassaṃ upagatā;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.41.eng: “We’re so fortunate that such monks have come to us for the rainy-season residence.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.42.pli: na vata no ito pubbe evarūpā bhikkhū vassaṃ upagatā yathayime bhikkhū sīlavanto kalyāṇadhammā”ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.42.eng: Such virtuous and good monks have never before entered the rains residence with us.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.43.pli: te na tādisāni bhojanāni attanā paribhuñjanti mātāpitūnaṃ denti puttadārassa denti dāsakammakaraporisassa denti mittāmaccānaṃ denti ñātisālohitānaṃ denti, yādisāni bhikkhūnaṃ denti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.43.eng: And they gave such food and drink to those monks that they did not even eat and drink themselves, or give to their parents, to their wives and children, to their slaves, servants, and workers, to their friends and companions, or to their relatives.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.44.pli: Te na tādisāni khādanīyāni sāyanīyāni pānāni attanā khādanti sāyanti pivanti mātāpitūnaṃ denti puttadārassa denti dāsakammakaraporisassa denti mittāmaccānaṃ denti ñātisālohitānaṃ denti, yādisāni bhikkhūnaṃ denti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.45.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū vaṇṇavā ahesuṃ pīṇindriyā pasannamukhavaṇṇā vippasannachavivaṇṇā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.1.45.eng: Soon those monks had a good color, bright faces, clear skin, and  sharp senses.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.1.pli: Āciṇṇaṃ kho panetaṃ vassaṃvuṭṭhānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ bhagavantaṃ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.1.eng: Now it was the custom for monks who had completed the rainy-season residence to go and visit the Buddha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.2.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū vassaṃvuṭṭhā temāsaccayena senāsanaṃ saṃsāmetvā pattacīvaraṃ ādāya yena vesālī tena pakkamiṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.2.eng: And so, when the three months were over and they had completed the rains residence, those monks put their dwellings in order, took their bowls and robes, and set out for Vesālī.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.3.pli: Anupubbena yena vesālī mahāvanaṃ kūṭāgārasālā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdiṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.3.eng: When they eventually arrived, they went to the hall with the peaked roof in the Great Wood. There they approached the Buddha, bowed, and sat down.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.4.pli: Tena kho pana samayena disāsu vassaṃvuṭṭhā bhikkhū kisā honti lūkhā dubbaṇṇā uppaṇḍuppaṇḍukajātā dhamanisanthatagattā;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.4.eng: At that time the monks who had completed the rains residence in that region were thin, haggard, and pale, with veins protruding all over their bodies.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.5.pli: vaggumudātīriyā pana bhikkhū vaṇṇavā honti pīṇindriyā pasannamukhavaṇṇā vippasannachavivaṇṇā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.5.eng: Yet the monks from the banks of the Vaggumudā had a good color, bright faces, clear skin, and  sharp senses.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.6.pli: Āciṇṇaṃ kho panetaṃ buddhānaṃ bhagavantānaṃ āgantukehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ paṭisammodituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.6.eng: Since it is the custom for Buddhas to greet newly-arrived monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.7.pli: Atha kho bhagavā vaggumudātīriye bhikkhū etadavoca—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.8.eng: “I hope you’re keeping well, monks, I hope you’re getting by?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.9.pli: kacci samaggā sammodamānā avivadamānā phāsukaṃ vassaṃ vasittha, na ca piṇḍakena kilamitthā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.9.eng: I hope you had a comfortable and harmonious rains, and got almsfood without trouble?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.10.eng: “We’re keeping well, sir, we’re getting by.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.11.pli: Samaggā ca mayaṃ, bhante, sammodamānā avivadamānā phāsukaṃ vassaṃ vasimhā, na ca piṇḍakena kilamimhā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.11.eng: We had a comfortable and harmonious rains, and got almsfood without trouble.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.12.pli: Jānantāpi tathāgatā pucchanti, jānantāpi na pucchanti …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.12.eng: When Buddhas know what is going on, sometimes they ask and sometimes not. They know the right time to ask and when not to ask. Buddhas ask when it is beneficial, otherwise they do not, for Buddhas are incapable of doing what is unbeneficial.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.12.comm: “Incapable of doing” renders setughāta, literally, “destroyed the bridge”. Sp 1.16: Setu vuccati maggo, maggeneva tādisassa vacanassa ghāto, samucchedoti vuttaṁ hoti, “The path is called the bridge. What is said is that there is the destruction and cutting off of such speech by the path.” The commentary seems to take setu, “bridge”, as a reference to the eightfold path. According to this understanding, the Buddha has cut off access to bad qualities, including bad speech, by fulfilling the eightfold path. I prefer to understand “bridge” as a metaphor for access, that is, the Buddhas no longer have access to what is unbeneficial.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.13.pli: dvīhākārehi buddhā bhagavanto bhikkhū paṭipucchanti— “dhammaṃ vā desessāma, sāvakānaṃ vā sikkhāpadaṃ paññapessāmā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.13.eng: Buddhas question the monks for two reasons: to give a teaching or to lay down a training rule.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.14.pli: Atha kho bhagavā vaggumudātīriye bhikkhū etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.14.eng: And the Buddha said to those monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.15.pli: “yathā kathaṃ pana tumhe, bhikkhave, samaggā sammodamānā avivadamānā phāsukaṃ vassaṃ vasittha na ca piṇḍakena kilamitthā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.15.eng: “In what way, monks, did you have a comfortable and harmonious rains? And how did you get almsfood without trouble?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.16.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.17.eng: “But did you really have those superhuman qualities?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.20.pli: “ananucchavikaṃ, moghapurisā, ananulomikaṃ appatirūpaṃ assāmaṇakaṃ akappiyaṃ akaraṇīyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.20.eng: “It’s not suitable, foolish men, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of a monastic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.21.pli: Kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, udarassa kāraṇā gihīnaṃ aññamaññassa uttarimanussadhammassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsissatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.21.eng: How could you for the sake of your stomachs talk up one another’s superhuman qualities to householders?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.22.pli: Varaṃ tumhehi, moghapurisā, tiṇhena govikantanena kucchi parikanto, na tveva udarassa kāraṇā gihīnaṃ aññamaññassa uttarimanussadhammassa vaṇṇo bhāsito.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.22.eng: It would be better for your bellies to be cut open with a sharp butcher’s knife than for you to talk up one another’s superhuman qualities to householders.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.24.pli: Tatonidānañhi, moghapurisā, maraṇaṃ vā nigaccheyya maraṇamattaṃ vā dukkhaṃ,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.24.eng: For although it might cause death or death-like suffering,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.25.pli: na tveva tappaccayā kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjeyya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.25.eng: it would not cause you to be reborn in a bad destination.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.26.pli: Itonidānañca kho, moghapurisā, kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā apāyaṃ duggatiṃ vinipātaṃ nirayaṃ upapajjeyya.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.28.pli: vigarahitvā dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.2.28.eng: After rebuking them and giving a teaching, he addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.1.eng: “Monks, there are these five notorious gangsters to be found in the world.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekaccassa mahācorassa evaṃ hoti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.3.eng: There is the notorious gangster who thinks like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.4.pli: ‘kudāssu nāmāhaṃ satena vā sahassena vā parivuto gāmanigamarājadhānīsu āhiṇḍissāmi
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.4.eng: ‘When the heck will I walk about in villages, towns, and royal capitals, with a following of a hundred or a thousand men,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.5.pli: hananto ghātento chindanto chedāpento pacanto pācento’ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.6.pli: So aparena samayena satena vā sahassena vā parivuto gāmanigamarājadhānīsu āhiṇḍati hananto ghātento chindanto chedāpento pacanto pācento.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.6.eng: Then after some time, he does just that.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.7.pli: Evameva kho, bhikkhave, idhekaccassa pāpabhikkhuno evaṃ hoti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.7.eng: Just so, monks, a bad monk thinks like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.8.pli: ‘kudāssu nāmāhaṃ satena vā sahassena vā parivuto gāmanigamarājadhānīsu cārikaṃ carissāmi
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.8.eng: ‘When the heck will I walk about in villages, towns, and royal capitals, with a following of a hundred or a thousand people,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.9.pli: sakkato garukato mānito pūjito apacito gahaṭṭhānañceva pabbajitānañca, lābhī cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārānan’ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.9.eng: being honored, respected, and revered by both lay people and those gone forth, getting robes, almsfood, dwellings, and medicinal supplies?’

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.10.pli: So aparena samayena satena vā sahassena vā parivuto gāmanigamarājadhānīsu cārikaṃ carati sakkato garukato mānito pūjito apacito gahaṭṭhānañceva pabbajitānañca, lābhī cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.10.eng: Then after some time, he does just that.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.11.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, paṭhamo mahācoro santo saṃvijjamāno lokasmiṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.11.eng: This is the first notorious gangster to be found in the world.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.12.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, idhekacco pāpabhikkhu tathāgatappaveditaṃ dhammavinayaṃ pariyāpuṇitvā attano dahati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.12.eng: Or a bad monk learns the spiritual path proclaimed by the Buddha and takes it as his own.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.13.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, dutiyo mahācoro santo saṃvijjamāno lokasmiṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.13.eng: This is the second notorious gangster to be found in the world.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.14.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, idhekacco pāpabhikkhu suddhaṃ brahmacāriṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ carantaṃ amūlakena abrahmacariyena anuddhaṃseti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.14.eng: Or a bad monk groundlessly charges someone living a pure spiritual life with a sexual offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.15.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, tatiyo mahācoro santo saṃvijjamāno lokasmiṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.15.eng: This is the third notorious gangster to be found in the world.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.16.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, idhekacco pāpabhikkhu yāni tāni saṅghassa garubhaṇḍāni garuparikkhārāni, seyyathidaṃ—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.16.eng: Or a bad monk takes valuable goods and requisites from the Sangha—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.17.pli: ārāmo ārāmavatthu vihāro vihāravatthu mañco pīṭhaṃ bhisi bibbohanaṃ lohakumbhī lohabhāṇakaṃ lohavārako lohakaṭāhaṃ vāsi parasu kuṭhārī kudālo nikhādanaṃ valli veḷu muñjaṃ pabbajaṃ tiṇaṃ mattikā dārubhaṇḍaṃ mattikābhaṇḍaṃ,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.17.eng: a monastery, the land of a monastery, a dwelling, the site of a dwelling, a bed, a bench, a mattress, a pillow, a metal pot, a metal jar, a metal bucket, a metal bowl, a machete, a hatchet, an ax, a spade, a chisel, a creeper, bamboo, a reed, grass, clay, wooden goods, earthenware goods—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.17.comm: I have rendered muñja-reed and pabbaja-reed with the single word “reed”. I am not aware that these two kinds of reed can be distinguished in English. │ I render vihāra as “dwelling”, the idea that it is a monastic dwelling being implied. In later usage, especially in the commentaries, vihāra comes to refer to entire monasteries, rather than individual dwellings. The commentaries seem to agree that in its early usage the word refers to a dwelling. Sp 1.493: Vihāro nivesanasadiso, “A vihāra is like a house.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.18.eng: and uses them to bribe and create a following among householders.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.19.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, catuttho mahācoro santo saṃvijjamāno lokasmiṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.19.eng: This is the fourth notorious gangster to be found in the world.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.20.pli: Sadevake, bhikkhave, loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya ayaṃ aggo mahācoro yo asantaṃ abhūtaṃ uttarimanussadhammaṃ ullapati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.20.eng: But in this world with its gods, lords of death, and supreme beings, in this society with its monastics and brahmins, its gods and humans, this is the most notorious gangster of all: one who claims to have a non-existent superhuman quality.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.22.eng: Monks, you’ve eaten the country’s almsfood by theft.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.23.comm: This verse is also found at SN 1.35.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.24.eng: To be other than he truly is,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.26.eng: Like a cheater who has deceived.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.31.eng: It’s better to eat an iron ball,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.32.eng: As hot as a licking flame,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.33.eng: Than for the immoral and uncontrolled

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.35.pli: Atha kho bhagavā vaggumudātīriye bhikkhū anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā dubbharatāya dupposatāya …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.35.eng: After rebuking the monks from the banks of the Vaggumudā in many ways for being difficult to maintain, difficult to support …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.36.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.36.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.37.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu anabhijānaṃ uttarimanussadhammaṃ attupanāyikaṃ alamariyañāṇadassanaṃ samudācareyya—‘iti jānāmi iti passāmī’ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.37.1.eng: ‘If a monk falsely claims for himself a superhuman quality, a knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones, saying, “This I know, this I see,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.38.pli: tato aparena samayena samanuggāhīyamāno vā asamanuggāhīyamāno vā āpanno visuddhāpekkho evaṃ vadeyya—‘ajānamevaṃ, āvuso, avacaṃ jānāmi, apassaṃ passāmi. Tucchaṃ musā vilapin’ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.38.eng: but after some time—whether questioned or not, but having committed the offense and seeking purification—should say: “Not knowing I said that I know, not seeing that I see; what I said was empty and false,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.39.eng: he too is expelled and excluded from the community.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.40.pli: Evañcidaṃ bhagavatā bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññattaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:1.3.40.eng: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:2.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhū adiṭṭhe diṭṭhasaññino apatte pattasaññino anadhigate adhigatasaññino asacchikate sacchikatasaññino adhimānena aññaṃ byākariṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:2.1.eng: Soon afterwards a number of monks, thinking they had seen and realized what in fact they had not, declared final knowledge because of overestimation.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:2.2.pli: Tesaṃ aparena samayena rāgāyapi cittaṃ namati dosāyapi cittaṃ namati mohāyapi cittaṃ namati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:2.2.eng: After some time, their minds inclined to sensual desire, ill will, and confusion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:2.4.eng: “The Buddha has laid down a training rule,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:2.5.pli: Mayañcamha adiṭṭhe diṭṭhasaññino apatte pattasaññino anadhigate adhigatasaññino asacchikate sacchikatasaññino, adhimānena aññaṃ byākarimhā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:2.5.eng: yet we declared final knowledge because of overestimation.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:2.6.pli: Kacci nu kho mayaṃ pārājikaṃ āpattiṃ āpannā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:2.6.eng: Could it be that we’ve committed an offense entailing expulsion?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:2.9.pli: “Honti ye te, ānanda, bhikkhū adiṭṭhe diṭṭhasaññino apatte pattasaññino anadhigate adhigatasaññino asacchikate sacchikatasaññino adhimānena aññaṃ byākaronti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:2.11.eng: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:2.12.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu anabhijānaṃ uttarimanussadhammaṃ attupanāyikaṃ alamariyañāṇadassanaṃ samudācareyya—‘iti jānāmi iti passāmī’ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:2.12.1.eng: ‘If a monk falsely claims for himself a superhuman quality, a knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones, saying, “This I know, this I see,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:2.13.pli: tato aparena samayena samanuggāhīyamāno vā asamanuggāhīyamāno vā āpanno visuddhāpekkho evaṃ vadeyya—‘ajānamevaṃ, āvuso, avacaṃ jānāmi, apassaṃ passāmi. Tucchaṃ musā vilapin’ti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:2.13.eng: but after some time—whether he is questioned or not, but having committed the offense and seeking purification—should say: “Not knowing I said that I know, not seeing that I see; what I said was empty and false,” then,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:2.14.eng: except if it is due to overestimation,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:2.15.eng: he too is expelled and excluded from the community.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:3.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:3.6.pli: asantaṃ abhūtaṃ asaṃvijjamānaṃ ajānanto apassanto attani kusalaṃ dhammaṃ— atthi me kusalo dhammoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:3.6.eng: although a certain wholesome quality is non-existent in himself, not real, not to be found, and he does not see it or know it, he says, “I have this wholesome quality.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:3.8.pli: jhānaṃ vimokkho samādhi samāpatti ñāṇadassanaṃ maggabhāvanā phalasacchikiriyā kilesappahānaṃ vinīvaraṇatā cittassa suññāgāre abhirati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:3.8.eng: absorption, release, stillness, attainment, knowledge and vision, development of the path, realization of the fruits, abandoning the defilements, a mind without hindrances, delighting in solitude.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:3.8.comm: “Delighting in solitude” renders suññāgāra abhirati, literally, “delighting in an empty dwelling”. According to the commentaries, this is often an idiom for solitude. MN-a 1.88: Tattha ca rukkhamūlānīti iminā rukkhamūlasenāsanaṁ dasseti. Suññāgārānīti iminā janavivittaṭṭhānaṁ; “And there rukkhamūlāni: by this is shown dwellings at the foot of a tree; suññāgārāni: by this (is shown) a place free from people.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:3.10.pli: te vā kusale dhamme attani upaneti attānaṃ vā tesu kusalesu dhammesu upaneti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:3.10.eng: either he presents those good qualities as in himself, or he presents himself as among those good qualities.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:3.14.pli: yaṃ ñāṇaṃ taṃ dassanaṃ, yaṃ dassanaṃ taṃ ñāṇaṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:3.16.pli: āroceyya itthiyā vā purisassa vā gahaṭṭhassa vā pabbajitassa vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:3.16.eng: announces to a woman or a man, to a lay person or one gone forth.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:3.17.eng: This I know, this I see:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:3.18.pli: jānāmahaṃ ete dhamme, passāmahaṃ ete dhamme atthi ca ete dhammā mayi, ahañca etesu dhammesu sandissāmīti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:3.18.eng: “I know these qualities,” “I see these qualities,” “These qualities are found in me and I conform to them.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:3.20.pli: yasmiṃ khaṇe samudāciṇṇaṃ hoti taṃ khaṇaṃ taṃ layaṃ taṃ muhuttaṃ vītivatte.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:3.20.eng: the moment, the second, the instant after he has made the claim.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:3.22.pli: yaṃ vatthu paṭiññātaṃ hoti tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ samanuggāhīyamāno—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:3.22.eng: he is questioned in regard to what he has claimed:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:3.30.eng: he is not spoken to by anyone.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:3.32.pli: pāpiccho icchāpakato asantaṃ abhūtaṃ uttarimanussadhammaṃ ullapitvā pārājikaṃ āpattiṃ āpanno hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:3.32.eng: having bad desires, overcome by desire, claiming to have a non-existent superhuman quality, he has committed an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:3.34.pli: gihī vā hotukāmo upāsako vā hotukāmo ārāmiko vā hotukāmo sāmaṇero vā hotukāmo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:3.34.eng: he desires to be a householder, a lay follower, a monastery worker, or a novice monk.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:3.35.eng: Not knowing I said that I know, not seeing that I see:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:3.36.pli: nāhaṃ ete dhamme jānāmi, nāhaṃ ete dhamme passāmi, natthi ca ete dhammā mayi, na cāhaṃ etesu dhammesu sandissāmīti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:3.36.eng: “I don’t know these qualities,” “I don’t see these qualities,” “These qualities aren’t found in me and I don’t conform to them.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:3.37.eng: What I said was empty and false:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:3.38.pli: tucchakaṃ mayā bhaṇitaṃ, musā mayā bhaṇitaṃ, abhūtaṃ mayā bhaṇitaṃ, ajānantena mayā bhaṇitaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:3.38.eng: “What I said was empty,” “What I said was false,” “What I said was unreal,” “I said it without knowing.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:3.39.eng: Except if it is due to overestimation:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:3.40.eng: unless it is due to overestimation.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:3.42.eng: this is said with reference to the preceding offenses entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:3.44.pli: seyyathāpi nāma tālo matthakacchinno abhabbo puna virūḷhiyā;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:3.44.eng: just as a palm tree with its crown cut off is incapable of further growth,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:3.45.pli: evameva bhikkhu pāpiccho icchāpakato asantaṃ abhūtaṃ uttarimanussadhammaṃ ullapitvā assamaṇo hoti asakyaputtiyo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:3.45.eng: so too is a monk with bad desires, overcome by desire, who claims to have a non-existent superhuman quality not an ascetic, not a Sakyan monastic.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:3.46.eng: Therefore it is said, “he is expelled.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:3.48.pli: saṃvāso nāma ekakammaṃ ekuddeso samasikkhatā— eso saṃvāso nāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:3.48.eng: Community: joint legal procedures, a joint recitation, the same training—this is called “community”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:3.49.pli: So tena saddhiṃ natthi. Tena vuccati— “asaṃvāso”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:3.49.eng: He does not take part in this—therefore it is called “excluded from the community”.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.1.2.pli: jhānaṃ vimokkho samādhi samāpatti ñāṇadassanaṃ maggabhāvanā phalasacchikiriyā kilesappahānaṃ vinīvaraṇatā cittassa suññāgāre abhirati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.1.2.eng: absorption, release, stillness, attainment, knowledge and vision, development of the path, realization of the fruits, abandoning the defilements, a mind without hindrances, delighting in solitude.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.1.4.pli: paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ dutiyaṃ jhānaṃ tatiyaṃ jhānaṃ catutthaṃ jhānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.1.4.eng: the first absorption, the second absorption, the third absorption, the fourth absorption.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.1.6.pli: suññato vimokkho animitto vimokkho appaṇihito vimokkho.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.1.6.eng: emptiness release, signless release, desireless release.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.1.8.pli: suññato samādhi animitto samādhi appaṇihito samādhi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.1.8.eng: emptiness stillness, signless stillness, desireless stillness.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.1.10.pli: suññatā samāpatti animittā samāpatti appaṇihitā samāpatti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.1.10.eng: emptiness attainment, signless attainment, desireless attainment.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.1.14.pli: cattāro satipaṭṭhānā, cattāro sammappadhānā, cattāro iddhipādā, pañcindriyāni, pañca balāni, satta bojjhaṅgā, ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.1.14.eng: the four applications of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four foundations for supernormal power, the five spiritual faculties, the five spiritual powers, the seven factors of awakening, the noble eightfold path.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.1.16.pli: sotāpattiphalassa sacchikiriyā, sakadāgāmiphalassa sacchikiriyā, anāgāmiphalassa sacchikiriyā, arahattassa sacchikiriyā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.1.16.eng: realization of the fruit of stream-entry, realization of the fruit of once-returning, realization of the fruit of non-returning, realization of perfection.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.1.18.pli: rāgassa pahānaṃ dosassa pahānaṃ mohassa pahānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.1.18.eng: the abandoning of sensual desire, the abandoning of ill will, the abandoning of confusion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.1.20.pli: rāgā cittaṃ vinīvaraṇatā, dosā cittaṃ vinīvaraṇatā, mohā cittaṃ vinīvaraṇatā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.1.20.eng: a mind without sensual desire, a mind without ill will, a mind without confusion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.1.22.eng: because of the first absorption, there is delight in solitude;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.1.23.eng: because of the second absorption, there is delight in solitude;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.1.24.eng: because of the third absorption, there is delight in solitude;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.1.25.eng: because of the fourth absorption, there is delight in solitude.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.2.1.pli: Tīhākārehi paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ samāpajjinti sampajānamusā bhaṇantassa āpatti pārājikassa—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.2.1.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying, “I attained the first absorption,” he commits an offense entailing expulsion when three conditions are fulfilled:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.2.2.eng: before he has lied, he knows he is going to lie;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.2.3.eng: while lying, he knows he is lying;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.2.4.eng: after he has lied, he knows he has lied.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.2.5.pli: Catūhākārehi paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ samāpajjinti sampajānamusā bhaṇantassa āpatti pārājikassa—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.2.5.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying, “I attained the first absorption,” he commits an offense entailing expulsion when four conditions are fulfilled:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.2.6.eng: before he has lied, he knows he is going to lie;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.2.7.eng: while lying, he knows he is lying;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.2.8.eng: after he has lied, he knows he has lied;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.2.9.eng: he misrepresents his view of what is true.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.2.9.comm: “Of what is true” is not in the Pali, but has been added for clarity.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.2.10.pli: Pañcahākārehi paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ samāpajjinti sampajānamusā bhaṇantassa āpatti pārājikassa—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.2.10.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying, “I attained the first absorption,” he commits an offense entailing expulsion when five conditions are fulfilled:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.2.11.eng: before he has lied, he knows he is going to lie;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.2.12.eng: while lying, he knows he is lying;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.2.13.eng: after he has lied, he knows he has lied;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.2.14.eng: he misrepresents his view of what is true; he misrepresents his belief of what is true.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.2.15.pli: Chahākārehi paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ samāpajjinti sampajānamusā bhaṇantassa āpatti pārājikassa—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.2.15.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying, “I attained the first absorption,” he commits an offense entailing expulsion when six conditions are fulfilled:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.2.16.eng: before he has lied, he knows he is going to lie;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.2.17.eng: while lying, he knows he is lying;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.2.18.eng: after he has lied, he knows he has lied;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.2.19.eng: he misrepresents his view of what is true;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.2.20.eng: he misrepresents his belief of what is true;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.2.21.eng: he misrepresents his acceptance of what is true.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.2.22.pli: Sattahākārehi paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ samāpajjinti sampajānamusā bhaṇantassa āpatti pārājikassa—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.2.22.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying, “I attained the first absorption,” he commits an offense entailing expulsion when seven conditions are fulfilled:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.2.23.eng: before he has lied, he knows he is going to lie;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.2.24.eng: while lying, he knows he is lying;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.2.25.eng: after he has lied, he knows he has lied;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.2.26.eng: he misrepresents his view of what is true;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.2.27.eng: he misrepresents his belief of what is true;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.2.28.eng: he misrepresents his acceptance of what is true;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.2.29.eng: he misrepresents his sentiment of what is true.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.3.1.pli: Tīhākārehi paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ samāpajjāmīti sampajānamusā bhaṇantassa āpatti pārājikassa—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.3.1.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying, “I’m attaining the first absorption,” he commits an offense entailing expulsion when three conditions are fulfilled:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.3.2.eng: before he has lied, he knows he is going to lie;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.3.3.eng: while lying, he knows he is lying;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.3.4.eng: after he has lied, he knows he has lied.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.3.5.pli: Catūhākārehi paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ samāpajjāmīti sampajānamusā bhaṇantassa āpatti pārājikassa—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.3.5.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying, “I’m attaining the first absorption,” he commits an offense entailing expulsion when four conditions are fulfilled:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.3.6.eng: before he has lied, he knows he is going to lie;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.3.7.eng: while lying, he knows he is lying;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.3.8.eng: after he has lied, he knows he has lied;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.3.9.eng: he misrepresents his view of what is true.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.3.10.pli: Pañcahākārehi paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ samāpajjāmīti sampajānamusā bhaṇantassa āpatti pārājikassa—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.3.10.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying, “I’m attaining the first absorption,” he commits an offense entailing expulsion when five conditions are fulfilled:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.3.11.eng: before he has lied, he knows he is going to lie;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.3.12.eng: while lying, he knows he is lying;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.3.13.eng: after he has lied, he knows he has lied;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.3.14.eng: he misrepresents his view of what is true;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.3.15.eng: he misrepresents his belief of what is true.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.3.16.pli: Chahākārehi paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ samāpajjāmīti sampajānamusā bhaṇantassa āpatti pārājikassa—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.3.16.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying, “I’m attaining the first absorption,” he commits an offense entailing expulsion when six conditions are fulfilled:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.3.17.eng: before he has lied, he knows he is going to lie;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.3.18.eng: while lying, he knows he is lying;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.3.19.eng: after he has lied, he knows he has lied;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.3.20.eng: he misrepresents his view of what is true;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.3.21.eng: he misrepresents his belief of what is true;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.3.22.eng: he misrepresents his acceptance of what is true.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.3.23.pli: Sattahākārehi paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ samāpajjāmīti sampajānamusā bhaṇantassa āpatti pārājikassa—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.3.23.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying, “I’m attaining the first absorption,” he commits an offense entailing expulsion when seven conditions are fulfilled:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.3.24.eng: before he has lied, he knows he is going to lie;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.3.25.eng: while lying, he knows he is lying;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.3.26.eng: after he has lied, he knows he has lied;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.3.27.eng: he misrepresents his view of what is true;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.3.28.eng: he misrepresents his belief of what is true;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.3.29.eng: he misrepresents his acceptance of what is true;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.3.30.eng: he misrepresents his sentiment of what is true.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.3.31.pli: Tīhākārehi paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ samāpannoti sampajānamusā bhaṇantassa āpatti pārājikassa—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:4.3.31.eng: If he lies in full awareness, saying, “I’ve attained the first absorption,” he commits an offense entailing expulsion when three conditions are fulfilled:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:5.1.0.eng: Meaning to say first absorption, but saying something else

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:5.1.1.pli: Tīhākārehi paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ samāpajjinti vattukāmo dutiyaṃ jhānaṃ samāpajjinti sampajānamusā bhaṇantassa paṭivijānantassa āpatti pārājikassa;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:5.1.1.eng: If he lies in full awareness, meaning to say, “I attained the first absorption,” while actually saying, “I attained the second absorption,” then, if the listener understands, he commits an offense entailing expulsion when three conditions are fulfilled;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:5.1.1.comm: “If the listener understands” renders paṭivijānantassa. This is in accordance with Sp 1.219, which has this to say: Atha pana yassa āroceti, so na jānāti “ki ayaṁ bhaṇatī”ti, saṁsayaṁ vā āpajjati, ciraṁ vīmaṁsitvā vā pacchā jānāti, appaṭivijānanto icceva saṅkhyaṁ gacchati”, “When he who is informed does not understand, thinking, ‘What does he say?’ or he has doubt, or he understands after reflecting for a long time, then it is considered ‘one who does not understand.’” Grammatically paṭivijānantassa could refer to either the speaker or the listener (it can be regarded as a genitive agreeing with bhaṇantassa, thus referring to the speaker, or it can be regarded as a dative of the person spoken to, that is, the listener), but logically it seems it must refer to the listener. In accordance with common usage, “understanding” (paṭivijānantassa) must refer to understanding the overall meaning of what is said, not to knowing the exact words that have been spoken. Since the speaker knows he is lying, he understands the overall meaning. It follows that the understanding here must refer to the listener. A parallel construction is found at Bu Pj 1:8.4.10 where paṭivijānāti is used in connection with giving up the monastic training. Here the verb clearly refers to understanding on the part of the listener, that is, one has only succeeded in renouncing the training if the listener understands what one is saying. At Bu Ss 3:4.1.4 the same verb, this time in the aorist form paṭivijāni, again refers to the listener.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:5.1.2.eng: if the listener does not understand, he commits a serious offense when three conditions are fulfilled.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:8.13.17.eng: Could it be that I’ve committed an offense entailing expulsion?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:8.13.20.eng: “I didn’t intend to make a claim, sir.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:8.13.21.eng: “There’s no offense for one who doesn’t intend to make a claim.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:8.14.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhū katikaṃ katvā aññatarasmiṃ āvāse vassaṃ upagacchiṃsu—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:8.14.1.eng: At one time a number of monks entered the rainy-season residence in a certain monastery, making this agreement:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:8.14.2.pli: “yo imamhā āvāsā paṭhamaṃ pakkamissati taṃ mayaṃ arahāti jānissāmā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:8.14.2.eng: “Whoever sets out from this monastery first, we’ll know him as a perfected one.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:8.14.4.eng: “Let them think I’m a perfected one,”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:8.14.5.eng: and he set out first from that monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā ca lakkhaṇo āyasmā ca mahāmoggallāno gijjhakūṭe pabbate viharanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.1.2.eng: Venerable Lakkhaṇa and Venerable Mahāmoggallāna were staying on the Vulture Peak.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.1.3.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaraṃ ādāya yenāyasmā lakkhaṇo tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ lakkhaṇaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.1.3.eng: One morning Mahāmoggallāna robed up, took his bowl and robe, went to Lakkhaṇa, and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.1.5.pli: “Evamāvuso”ti kho āyasmā lakkhaṇo āyasmato mahāmoggallānassa paccassosi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.1.6.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno gijjhakūṭā pabbatā orohanto aññatarasmiṃ padese sitaṃ pātvākāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.1.6.eng: As they descended from the Vulture Peak, Mahāmoggallāna smiled at a certain place.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.1.7.pli: Atha kho āyasmā lakkhaṇo āyasmantaṃ mahāmoggallānaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.1.7.eng: Lakkhaṇa asked him why, and Māhamoggallāna replied,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.1.8.pli: “ko nu kho, āvuso moggallāna, hetu ko paccayo sitassa pātukammāyā”ti?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.1.9.eng: “This isn’t the right time to ask.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.1.10.pli: Bhagavato maṃ santike etaṃ pañhaṃ pucchā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.1.10.eng: Please ask me in the presence of the Buddha.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.2.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ca lakkhaṇo āyasmā ca mahāmoggallāno rājagahe piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṃ piṇḍapātapaṭikkantā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṃsu;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.2.1.eng: Then, when they had eaten their meal and returned from almsround, Lakkhaṇa and Mahāmoggallāna went to the Buddha,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.2.3.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā lakkhaṇo āyasmantaṃ mahāmoggallānaṃ etadavoca—

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.2.4.pli: “idhāyasmā mahāmoggallāno gijjhakūṭā pabbatā orohanto aññatarasmiṃ padese sitaṃ pātvākāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.2.4.eng: “Earlier on, as we were descending from the Vulture Peak, you smiled at a certain place.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.2.5.pli: Ko nu kho, āvuso moggallāna, hetu ko paccayo sitassa pātukammāyā”ti?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.2.6.pli: “Idhāhaṃ, āvuso, gijjhakūṭā pabbatā orohanto addasaṃ aṭṭhikasaṅkhalikaṃ vehāsaṃ gacchantiṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.2.6.eng: “As I was coming down from the Vulture Peak, I saw a skeleton flying through the air.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.2.7.pli: Tamenaṃ gijjhāpi kākāpi kulalāpi anupatitvā anupatitvā phāsuḷantarikāhi vituḍenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.2.7.eng: Vultures, crows, and hawks were pursuing it, striking it between the ribs,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.2.8.eng: while it uttered cries of distress.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.2.10.pli: ‘acchariyaṃ vata bho, abbhutaṃ vata bho, evarūpopi nāma satto bhavissati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.2.10.eng: how amazing and astonishing it is that such a being should exist,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.2.13.eng: But the monks complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.2.15.eng: The Buddha then said to them:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.2.18.pli: Yatra hi nāma sāvako evarūpaṃ ñassati vā dakkhati vā sakkhiṃ vā karissati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.2.18.eng: who can know, see, and witness such things.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.2.19.pli: Pubbeva me so, bhikkhave, satto diṭṭho ahosi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.2.19.eng: I too, monks, have seen that being,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.2.20.eng: but I didn’t speak about it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.2.21.pli: Ahañcetaṃ byākareyyaṃ pare ca me na saddaheyyuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.2.21.eng: If I had, others wouldn’t have believed me,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.2.22.pli: Ye me na saddaheyyuṃ tesaṃ taṃ assa dīgharattaṃ ahitāya dukkhāya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.2.22.eng: which would have led to their harm and suffering for a long time.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.2.23.pli: Eso, bhikkhave, satto imasmiṃyeva rājagahe goghātako ahosi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.2.23.eng: That being was a cattle butcher right here in Rājagaha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.2.24.pli: So tassa kammassa vipākena bahūni vassāni bahūni vassasatāni bahūni vassasahassāni bahūni vassasatasahassāni niraye paccitvā tasseva kammassa vipākāvasesena evarūpaṃ attabhāvappaṭilābhaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.2.24.eng: As a result of his deeds, he was tormented in hell for many hundreds of thousands of years. And now, because of the remaining result of his actions, he’s experiencing such an existence.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.1.pli: “Idhāhaṃ, āvuso, gijjhakūṭā pabbatā orohanto addasaṃ maṃsapesiṃ vehāsaṃ gacchantiṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.1.eng: “As I was coming down from the Vulture Peak, I saw a lump of flesh flying through the air.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.2.pli: Tamenaṃ gijjhāpi kākāpi kulalāpi anupatitvā anupatitvā vitacchenti vibhajjenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.2.eng: Vultures, crows, and hawks were pursuing it, tearing at it and pulling it to pieces,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.3.eng: while it uttered cries of distress. …” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.4.pli: eso, bhikkhave, satto imasmiṃyeva rājagahe goghātako ahosi …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.4.eng: “… That being, monks, was a cattle butcher right here in Rājagaha. …”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.5.pli: “Idhāhaṃ, āvuso, gijjhakūṭā pabbatā orohanto addasaṃ maṃsapiṇḍaṃ vehāsaṃ gacchantaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.5.eng: “As I was coming down from the Vulture Peak, I saw a morsel of flesh flying through the air.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.6.pli: Tamenaṃ gijjhāpi kākāpi kulalāpi anupatitvā anupatitvā vitacchenti vibhajjenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.6.eng: Vultures, crows, and hawks were pursuing it, tearing at it and pulling it to pieces,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.7.eng: while it uttered cries of distress. …” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.8.pli: eso, bhikkhave, satto imasmiṃyeva rājagahe sākuṇiko ahosi …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.8.eng: “… That being, monks, was a poultry butcher right here in Rājagaha. …”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.9.pli: “Idhāhaṃ, āvuso, gijjhakūṭā pabbatā orohanto addasaṃ nicchaviṃ purisaṃ vehāsaṃ gacchantaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.9.eng: “As I was coming down from the Vulture Peak, I saw a flayed man flying through the air.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.10.pli: Tamenaṃ gijjhāpi kākāpi kulalāpi anupatitvā anupatitvā vitacchenti vibhajjenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.10.eng: Vultures, crows, and hawks were pursuing him, tearing at him and pulling him to pieces,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.11.eng: while he uttered cries of distress. …” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.12.pli: eso, bhikkhave, satto imasmiṃyeva rājagahe orabbhiko ahosi …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.12.eng: “… That being, monks, was a sheep butcher right here in Rājagaha. …”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.13.pli: “Idhāhaṃ, āvuso, gijjhakūṭā pabbatā orohanto addasaṃ asilomaṃ purisaṃ vehāsaṃ gacchantaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.13.eng: “As I was coming down from the Vulture Peak, I saw a man with swords for body hairs flying through the air.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.14.pli: Tassa te asī uppatitvā uppatitvā tasseva kāye nipatanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.14.eng: Again and again he was stabbed by those swords,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.16.pli: eso, bhikkhave, satto imasmiṃyeva rājagahe sūkariko ahosi …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.16.eng: “… That being, monks, was a pig butcher right here in Rājagaha. …”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.17.pli: “Idhāhaṃ, āvuso, gijjhakūṭā pabbatā orohanto addasaṃ sattilomaṃ purisaṃ vehāsaṃ gacchantaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.17.eng: “As I was coming down from the Vulture Peak, I saw a man with knives for body hairs flying through the air.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.18.pli: Tassa tā sattiyo uppatitvā uppatitvā tasseva kāye nipatanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.18.eng: Again and again he was stabbed by those knives,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.20.pli: eso, bhikkhave, satto imasmiṃyeva rājagahe māgaviko ahosi …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.20.eng: “… That being, monks, was a deer hunter right here in Rājagaha. …”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.21.pli: “Idhāhaṃ, āvuso, gijjhakūṭā pabbatā orohanto addasaṃ usulomaṃ purisaṃ vehāsaṃ gacchantaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.21.eng: “As I was coming down from the Vulture Peak, I saw a man with arrows for body hairs flying through the air.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.22.pli: Tassa te usū uppatitvā uppatitvā tasseva kāye nipatanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.22.eng: Again and again he was pierced by those arrows,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.24.pli: eso, bhikkhave, satto imasmiṃyeva rājagahe kāraṇiko ahosi …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.24.eng: “… That being, monks, was a torturer right here in Rājagaha. …”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.25.pli: “Idhāhaṃ, āvuso, gijjhakūṭā pabbatā orohanto addasaṃ sūcilomaṃ purisaṃ vehāsaṃ gacchantaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.25.eng: “As I was coming down from the Vulture Peak, I saw a man with needles for body hairs flying through the air.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.26.pli: Tassa tā sūciyo uppatitvā uppatitvā tasseva kāye nipatanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.26.eng: Again and again he was pierced by those needles,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.28.pli: eso, bhikkhave, satto imasmiṃyeva rājagahe sārathiko ahosi …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.28.eng: “… That being, monks, was a horse trainer right here in Rājagaha. …”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.29.pli: “Idhāhaṃ, āvuso, gijjhakūṭā pabbatā orohanto addasaṃ sūcilomaṃ purisaṃ vehāsaṃ gacchantaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.29.eng: “As I was coming down from the Vulture Peak, I saw a man with needles for body hairs flying through the air.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.30.pli: Tassa tā sūciyo sīse pavisitvā mukhato nikkhamanti;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.30.eng: Those needles entered his head and came out through his mouth,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.31.eng: entered his mouth and came out through his breast,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.32.eng: entered his breast and came out through his stomach,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.33.eng: entered his stomach and came out through his thighs,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.34.eng: entered his thighs and came out through his calves,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.35.eng: entered his calves and came out through his feet,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.36.eng: as he uttered cries of distress. …” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.37.pli: eso, bhikkhave, satto imasmiṃyeva rājagahe sūcako ahosi …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.37.eng: “… That being, monks, was a slanderer right here in Rājagaha. …”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.38.pli: “Idhāhaṃ, āvuso, gijjhakūṭā pabbatā orohanto addasaṃ kumbhaṇḍaṃ purisaṃ vehāsaṃ gacchantaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.38.eng: “As I was coming down from the Vulture Peak, I saw a man flying through the air with testicles like pots.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.39.pli: So gacchantopi teva aṇḍe khandhe āropetvā gacchati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.39.eng: When he moved, he lifted his testicles onto his shoulders;

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.40.eng: when he sat down, he sat on top of his testicles.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.41.pli: Tamenaṃ gijjhāpi kākāpi kulalāpi anupatitvā anupatitvā vitacchenti vibhajjenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.41.eng: Vultures, crows, and hawks were pursuing him, tearing at him and pulling him to pieces,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.42.eng: while he uttered cries of distress. …” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.43.pli: eso, bhikkhave, satto imasmiṃyeva rājagahe gāmakūṭo ahosi …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.43.eng: “… That being, monks, was a corrupt magistrate right here in Rājagaha. …”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.44.pli: “Idhāhaṃ, āvuso, gijjhakūṭā pabbatā orohanto addasaṃ purisaṃ gūthakūpe sasīsakaṃ nimuggaṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.44.eng: “As I was coming down from the Vulture Peak, I saw a man submerged in a cesspit …”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.45.pli: eso, bhikkhave, satto imasmiṃyeva rājagahe pāradāriko ahosi …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.45.eng: “… That being, monks, was an adulterer right here in Rājagaha. …”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.46.pli: “Idhāhaṃ, āvuso, gijjhakūṭā pabbatā orohanto addasaṃ purisaṃ gūthakūpe sasīsakaṃ nimuggaṃ ubhohi hatthehi gūthaṃ khādantaṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.46.eng: “As I was coming down from the Vulture Peak, I saw a man submerged in a cesspit, eating feces with both hands …”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.47.pli: eso, bhikkhave, satto imasmiṃyeva rājagahe duṭṭhabrāhmaṇo ahosi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.47.eng: “… That being, monks, was a wicked brahmin right here in Rājagaha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.48.pli: So kassapassa sammāsambuddhassa pāvacane bhikkhusaṅghaṃ bhattena nimantetvā doṇiyo gūthassa pūrāpetvā kālaṃ ārocāpetvā etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.48.eng: At the time of Kassapa, the fully Awakened One, he had invited the Sangha of monks to a meal. He filled a trough with feces, had them informed that the meal was ready, and said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.49.pli: ‘ato, bhonto, yāvadatthaṃ bhuñjantu ceva harantu cā’”ti …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.49.eng: ‘Sirs, eat as much as you like and take the leftovers with you.’ …”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.50.pli: “Idhāhaṃ, āvuso, gijjhakūṭā pabbatā orohanto addasaṃ nicchaviṃ itthiṃ vehāsaṃ gacchantiṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.50.eng: “As I was coming down from the Vulture Peak, I saw a flayed woman flying through the air.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.51.pli: Tamenaṃ gijjhāpi kākāpi kulalāpi anupatitvā anupatitvā vitacchenti vibhajjenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.51.eng: Vultures, crows, and hawks were pursuing her, tearing at her and pulling her to pieces,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.52.eng: while she uttered cries of distress. …” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.53.pli: esā, bhikkhave, itthī imasmiṃyeva rājagahe aticārinī ahosi …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.53.eng: “… That woman, monks, was an adulteress right here in Rājagaha. …”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.54.pli: “Idhāhaṃ, āvuso, gijjhakūṭā pabbatā orohanto addasaṃ itthiṃ duggandhaṃ maṅguliṃ vehāsaṃ gacchantiṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.54.eng: “As I was coming down from the Vulture Peak, I saw a foul-smelling and ugly woman flying through the air.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.55.pli: Tamenaṃ gijjhāpi kākāpi kulalāpi anupatitvā anupatitvā vitacchenti vibhajjenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.55.eng: Vultures, crows, and hawks were pursuing her, tearing at her and pulling her to pieces,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.56.eng: while she uttered cries of distress. …” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.57.pli: esā, bhikkhave, itthī imasmiṃyeva rājagahe ikkhaṇikā ahosi …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.57.eng: “… That woman, monks, was a fortune-teller right here in Rājagaha. …”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.58.pli: “Idhāhaṃ, āvuso, gijjhakūṭā pabbatā orohanto addasaṃ itthiṃ uppakkaṃ okiliniṃ okiriniṃ vehāsaṃ gacchantiṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.58.eng: “As I was coming down from the Vulture Peak, I saw a woman flying through the air, roasting, sweltering, and sooty.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.59.eng: Vultures, crows, and hawks were pursuing her, tearing at her and pulling her to pieces, while she uttered cries of distress. …” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.60.pli: esā, bhikkhave, itthī kāliṅgassa rañño aggamahesī ahosi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.60.eng: “… That woman, monks, was the chief queen of the king of Kāliṅga.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.61.eng: Overcome by jealousy, she poured a pan of burning coals over a rival. …”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.62.pli: “Idhāhaṃ, āvuso, gijjhakūṭā pabbatā orohanto addasaṃ asīsakaṃ kabandhaṃ vehāsaṃ gacchantaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.62.eng: “As I was coming down from the Vulture Peak, I saw the headless trunk of a body flying through the air,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.63.pli: Tassa ure akkhīni ceva honti mukhañca.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.63.eng: with eyes and mouth on its chest.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.64.pli: Tamenaṃ gijjhāpi kākāpi kulalāpi anupatitvā anupatitvā vitacchenti vibhajjenti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.64.eng: Vultures, crows, and hawks were pursuing it, tearing at it and pulling it to pieces,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.65.eng: while it uttered cries of distress. …” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.66.pli: eso, bhikkhave, satto imasmiṃyeva rājagahe hāriko nāma coraghātako ahosi …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.66.eng: “… That being, monks, was an executioner called Hārika right here in Rājagaha. …”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.67.pli: “Idhāhaṃ, āvuso, gijjhakūṭā pabbatā orohanto addasaṃ bhikkhuṃ vehāsaṃ gacchantaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.67.eng: “As I was coming down from the Vulture Peak, I saw a monk flying through the air.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.68.pli: Tassa saṅghāṭipi ādittā sampajjalitā sajotibhūtā, pattopi āditto sampajjalito sajotibhūto, kāyabandhanampi ādittaṃ sampajjalitaṃ sajotibhūtaṃ, kāyopi āditto sampajjalito sajotibhūto.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.68.eng: His outer robe was ablaze and burning, as were his bowl, belt, and body.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.68.comm: For the rendering of saṅghāṭi as “outer robe”, see Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.70.pli: eso, bhikkhave, bhikkhu kassapassa sammāsambuddhassa pāvacane pāpabhikkhu ahosi …pe….
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.70.eng: “… During the time of the Buddha Kassapa’s dispensation, he was a bad monk.” …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.71.pli: “Idhāhaṃ, āvuso, gijjhakūṭā pabbatā orohanto addasaṃ bhikkhuniṃ …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.71.eng: “As I was coming down from the Vulture Peak, I saw a nun …

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.74.eng: I saw a novice nun flying through the air.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.75.pli: Tassā saṅghāṭipi ādittā sampajjalitā sajotibhūtā, pattopi āditto sampajjalito sajotibhūto, kāyabandhanampi ādittaṃ sampajjalitaṃ sajotibhūtaṃ, kāyopi āditto sampajjalito sajotibhūto.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.75.eng: Her outer robe was ablaze and burning, as were her bowl, belt, and body.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.78.pli: ‘acchariyaṃ vata bho, abbhutaṃ vata bho, evarūpopi nāma satto bhavissati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.78.eng: how amazing and astonishing it is that such a being should exist,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.81.eng: But the monks complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.83.eng: The Buddha then said to them:

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.86.pli: Yatra hi nāma sāvako evarūpaṃ ñassati vā dakkhati vā sakkhiṃ vā karissati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.86.eng: who can see, know, and witness such things.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.87.pli: Pubbeva me sā, bhikkhave, sāmaṇerī diṭṭhā ahosi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.87.eng: I too, monks, have seen that novice nun,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.88.eng: but I didn’t speak about it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.89.pli: Ahañcetaṃ byākareyyaṃ pare ca me na saddaheyyuṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.89.eng: If I had, others wouldn’t have believed me,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.90.pli: Ye me na saddaheyyuṃ tesaṃ taṃ assa dīgharattaṃ ahitāya dukkhāya.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.90.eng: which would have led to their harm and suffering for a long time.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.91.pli: Esā, bhikkhave, sāmaṇerī kassapassa sammāsambuddhassa pāvacane pāpasāmaṇerī ahosi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.91.eng: During the time of Buddha Kassapa’s dispensation, she was a bad novice nun.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.92.pli: Sā tassa kammassa vipākena bahūni vassāni bahūni vassasatāni bahūni vassasahassāni bahūni vassasatasahassāni niraye paccitvā tasseva kammassa vipākāvasesena evarūpaṃ attabhāvappaṭilābhaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.3.92.eng: As a result of her deeds, she was tormented in hell for many hundreds of thousands of years. And now, because of the remaining result of her actions, she’s experiencing such an existence.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.4.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.4.1.eng: Venerable Mahāmoggallāna said to the monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.4.2.pli: “yatāyaṃ, āvuso, tapodā sandati so daho acchodako sītodako sātodako setako suppatittho ramaṇīyo pahūtamacchakacchapo cakkamattāni ca padumāni pupphantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.4.2.eng: “This stream, the Tapodā, flows from a lake with clear water—cool, sweet, and pure—with smooth and pleasant banks, with an abundance of fish and turtles, and with blooming lotuses the size of wheels.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.4.3.eng: The monks complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.4.4.eng: “How can Venerable Mahāmoggallāna talk like this

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.4.5.pli: ‘yatāyaṃ, āvuso, tapodā sandati so daho acchodako sītodako sātodako setako suppatittho ramaṇīyo pahūtamacchakacchapo cakkamattāni ca padumāni pupphantī’ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.4.6.pli: Atha ca panāyaṃ tapodā kuthitā sandati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.4.6.eng: when the Tapodā is actually hot?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.4.9.pli: “Yatāyaṃ, bhikkhave, tapodā sandati so daho acchodako sītodako sātodako setako suppatittho ramaṇīyo pahūtamacchakacchapo cakkamattāni ca padumāni pupphanti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.4.9.eng: “Monks, the Tapodā does flow from a lake with clear water—cool, sweet, and pure—with smooth and pleasant banks, with an abundance of fish and turtles, and with blooming lotuses the size of wheels.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.4.10.pli: Api cāyaṃ, bhikkhave, tapodā dvinnaṃ mahānirayānaṃ antarikāya āgacchati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.4.10.eng: But the Tapodā runs between two great hells.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.5.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena rājā māgadho seniyo bimbisāro licchavīhi saddhiṃ saṅgāmento pabhaggo ahosi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.5.1.eng: At one time King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha was defeated in battle by the Licchavīs.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.5.2.pli: Atha rājā pacchā senaṃ saṅkaḍḍhitvā licchavayo parājesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.5.2.eng: The king then rallied his army and beat the Licchavīs.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.5.3.eng: People were delighted and the word spread

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.5.4.eng: that the Licchavīs had been defeated by the king.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.5.5.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.5.5.eng: But Venerable Mahāmoggallāna said to the monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.5.6.eng: “The king was defeated by the Licchavīs.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.5.7.eng: The monks complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.5.8.eng: “How can Venerable Moggallāna talk like this

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.5.11.eng: and the word is spreading that the Licchavīs have been defeated by the king?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.5.14.eng: “Monks, first the king was defeated by the Licchavīs,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.5.15.pli: Atha rājā pacchā senaṃ saṅkaḍḍhitvā licchavayo parājesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.5.15.eng: but then he rallied his army and beat them.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.6.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahāmoggallāno bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.6.1.eng: Venerable Mahāmoggallāna said to the monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.6.2.pli: “idhāhaṃ, āvuso, sappinikāya nadiyā tīre āneñjaṃ samādhiṃ samāpanno nāgānaṃ ogayha uttarantānaṃ koñcaṃ karontānaṃ saddaṃ assosin”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.6.2.eng: “After attaining an unshakable stillness on the banks of the river Sappinikā, I heard the sound of elephants plunging in and emerging from the water, and trumpeting too.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.6.3.eng: The monks complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.6.4.pli: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā mahāmoggallāno āneñjaṃ samādhiṃ samāpanno saddaṃ sossati.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.6.4.eng: “How can Venerable Mahāmoggallāna talk like this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.6.7.pli: “Attheso, bhikkhave, samādhi so ca kho aparisuddho.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.6.7.eng: “Monks, there is such a stillness, but it’s not wholly purified.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.7.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā sobhito bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.7.1.eng: Venerable Sobhita said to the monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.7.3.eng: The monks complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.7.4.eng: “How can Venerable Sobhita talk like this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.7.9.eng: and that was just one birth.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.7.12.eng: The fourth offense entailing expulsion is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.7.13.pli: Uddiṭṭhā kho āyasmanto cattāro pārājikā dhammā,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.7.13.eng: “Venerables, the four rules on expulsion have been recited.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.7.14.pli: yesaṃ bhikkhu aññataraṃ vā aññataraṃ vā āpajjitvā na labhati bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ saṃvāsaṃ,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.7.14.eng: If a monk commits any one of them, he is no longer part of the community of monks.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.7.15.pli: yathā pure tathā pacchā, pārājiko hoti asaṃvāso.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.7.15.eng: As before, so after: he’s expelled and excluded from the community.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.7.16.eng: In regard to this I ask you,

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.7.22.eng: You are pure in this and therefore silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.7.24.eng: The offenses entailing expulsion are finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-pj4:9.7.30.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing expulsion is finished.
